articles.title: Income inequality dipped and fewer people moved, according to largest survey of U.S. life
articles.description:
The survey of 3.5 million households asked about more than 40 topics.

The post Income inequality dipped and fewer people moved, according to largest survey of U.S. life appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Income inequality in Boston decreased, reflecting broader national trends from the survey of 3.5 million households.
Fewer residents moved in 2023, indicating potential stability in Boston's housing market.
The survey results may influence local policies aimed at addressing economic disparities.

articles.title: Graphic video of the Charlie Kirk shooting was everywhere online, showing how media gatekeeper role has changed
articles.description:
Gory video of the shooting was available almost instantly online, from several angles, in slow-motion and real-time speed.

The post Graphic video of the Charlie Kirk shooting was everywhere online, showing how media gatekeeper role has changed appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Graphic video of Charlie Kirk's shooting circulated online shortly after the incident.
Videos were available from multiple angles, including slow-motion and real-time footage.
Boston residents face increased exposure to graphic content due to changing media dynamics.

articles.title: Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered
articles.description:
Kirk was killed with a gunshot from a distant rooftop at the Utah Valley University campus.

The post Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Charlie Kirk was shot and killed on September 11 at Utah Valley University.
Authorities recovered a high-powered rifle used in the shooting from a rooftop.
Boston residents may feel increased concern over campus safety and gun violence.

articles.title: ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC
articles.description:
"Bill Belichick's always been a petty, small-minded man, but when you win six Super Bowls and you're an assistant on two other ones, you can get away with that."

The post ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: College football analyst criticizes Bill Belichick's attitude at UNC, calling it 'petty' and 'small-minded'.
Belichick, a six-time Super Bowl champion, faces scrutiny as he transitions to college football.
Boston residents may feel concerned about Belichick's reputation affecting local sports culture.

articles.title: This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’
articles.description:
Her boyfriend placed second in the regular season. Together, the local couple leads the way in a fledging sport.

The post This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Addy Herman from Massachusetts placed 2nd on NBC's 'American Ninja Warrior'.
Her boyfriend also secured 2nd place in the regular season competition.
The couple's success highlights the growing popularity of ninja sports in Boston.

articles.title: Charlie Kirk’s widow, Erika, promoted conservative values at his side
articles.description:
Charlie Kirk often pointed to his marriage as an example of a loving, conservative partnership. The pair married in 2021 and had two children.

The post Charlie Kirk’s widow, Erika, promoted conservative values at his side appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Erika Kirk continues promoting conservative values following Charlie Kirk's passing in 2025.
The couple married in 2021 and had two children together.
Boston residents may see increased conservative activism in local communities.

articles.title: Hitting the nail on the head: The construction labor shortage is a crisis
articles.description:
Experts say drop in skilled laborers is contributing to lack of new housing being built.

The post Hitting the nail on the head: The construction labor shortage is a crisis appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Experts warn of a significant drop in skilled laborers affecting Boston's housing market.
Boston faces a housing shortage as new construction projects stall due to labor shortages.
Residents may experience increased housing costs and limited availability as a result.
